text: The Calumniated Wife is a motif in traditional narratives, numbered K2110.1 in Stith Thompson's Motif-Index of Folk-Literature. It entails a wife being falsely accused of, and often punished for, some crime or sin. This motif is at the centre of a number of traditional plots, being associated with tale- types 705–712 in the Aarne–Thompson–Uther Index of tale-types. ==Studies== * Bawden, C.
